Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Refrigerate \Re*frig"er*ate\ (-[=a]t), v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Refrigerated} (-[=a]`t[e^]d); p. pr. & vb. n. {Refrigerating}.] [L. refrigeratus, p. p. of refrigerare; pref. re- re- + frigerare to make cool, fr. frigus, frigoris, coolness. See {Frigid}.] To cause to become cool; to make or keep cold or cool. [1913 Webster]
refrigerated adj : made or kept cold by refrigeration; "keep the milk refrigerated"; "a refrigerated truck"
